text: In favor of a grown vineyard, as only seen in some climates, a poor deer chased, was able to hide his precious life. The hunters were disoriented and, calling their dogs, retreated. The deer that is saved by the leaves, O black ingratitude, is no longer fixed, and bites the beneficent plant. The hunters come back and there they sacrifice him. - I deserved that punishment. Ungrateful, forgetting the good I received. This example, children, teaches us something that must be valued: You must never betray those who have once benefited you. FIN
title: El ciervo y la viña
author: Jean de La Fontaine
